Title: Define vendor evaluation criteria
Description: Create a scored matrix covering source coverage, CDC method, schema drift handling, private networking, SLAs, pricing model, and API/DAG integrations.
Client Dependencies: List of source systems and compliance constraints; security & procurement requirements
Acceptance Criteria: Matrix complete, approved by PDA and Security
Notes: Include Snowflake Partner Connect availability; confirm support for required sources

Title: Spin up PoC via Snowflake Partner Connect
Description: Use Partner Connect to create a trial account with shortlisted vendor and auto-provision Snowflake objects; validate basic end-to-end load.
Client Dependencies: ACCOUNTADMIN access to Snowflake; ability to use Partner Connect
Deliverables: Working PoC connection and first sync
Acceptance Criteria: Initial tables replicated to Snowflake; credentials stored in secret manager

Title: Private networking design (PrivateLink / PSC)
Description: Decide on private networking with the vendor (AWS PrivateLink / Azure Private Link / GCP PSC). Produce sequence to enable and validate endpoints.
Client Dependencies: Target cloud & region; Snowflake edition; vendor account details
Acceptance Criteria: Connectivity validated privately (no public egress)
Notes: Coordinate with Snowflake and vendor to exchange service attachment IDs / VPC endpoints

Title: RBAC & least-privilege design for destination
Description: Define destination database/schema/warehouse and create service roles and grants following least-privilege; separate read vs. load roles.
Client Dependencies: Snowflake security policies; list of target databases/schemas
Deliverables: DDL scripts for roles, users, grants; runbook
Acceptance Criteria: Successful principle-of-least-privilege review

Title: Cost & capacity planning
Description: Estimate vendor costs and Snowflake compute/storage impact. Size warehouses for initial load and steady-state CDC. Define usage monitors.
Client Dependencies: Source data volumes and change rates; pricing tiers; business SLAs
Deliverables: Cost model; warehouse sizing; resource monitors
Acceptance Criteria: Stakeholder sign-off on forecast

Title: Inventory & prioritize source tables
Description: Compile table list, identify primary keys and update timestamps, classify tables by change rate and criticality.
Client Dependencies: Access to source data dictionary; SME time
Acceptance Criteria: Top-priority tables agreed with business

Title: Identify referential integrity & dependency groups (from SOURCE catalogs)
Description: Extract FK relationships from the SOURCE system catalogs (e.g., SQL Server sys.foreign_keys/sys.foreign_key_columns; Oracle ALL_CONSTRAINTS/ALL_CONS_COLUMNS; MySQL INFORMATION_SCHEMA.KEY_COLUMN_USAGE; PostgreSQL information_schema.referential_constraints). Build dependency groups ensuring parent tables precede children in orchestration.
Client Dependencies: Access to source schema FK metadata (or modeled FKs)
Acceptance Criteria: Graph reviewed; grouping rules captured for DAGs
Notes: Do NOT rely on Snowflake constraints; replicated targets may not carry/enforce FKs.

Title: Naming & schema evolution policy
Description: Decide destination naming (source vs vendor naming), case strategy, and rules for schema drift (new columns, PK changes).
Deliverables: Naming convention doc; drift handling policy
Acceptance Criteria: Policy approved by data governance

Title: Destination schema & warehouse provisioning
Description: Create destination DB/Schema(s) and dedicated warehouses for ingestion and analytics; configure auto-suspend/resume.
Acceptance Criteria: Test queries succeed; cost guardrails in place

Title: Standardize metadata columns
Description: Define and document metadata columns including vendor system columns and LEIT standard fields (ingestion_ts, source_system, load_batch_id).
Client Dependencies: Agreement on metadata model; vendor capabilities
Deliverables: Metadata column spec; downstream usage notes
Acceptance Criteria: Columns present in sample replicated tables

Title: Create reference tables for registry & dependencies
Description: Create reference tables to register sources, tables, sync settings, and dependency groups for orchestration.
Acceptance Criteria: Tables populated with first cut of data

Title: Configure connector authentication
Description: Create destination user/role and secrets; configure vendor connection using key pair or password per standards.
Acceptance Criteria: Connection test passes in vendor UI

Title: Select tables & columns; PKs and CDC options
Description: Enable required schemas/tables; confirm PKs; enable deletes capture/soft delete; exclude low-value objects.
Acceptance Criteria: Selection matches inventory; change capture enabled

Title: Set sync schedule & SLAs
Description: Set an initial sync frequency to meet freshness SLAs; document schedule and offset behavior; define daily window if applicable.
Client Dependencies: Business freshness targets; vendor plan limits
Acceptance Criteria: Schedule meets SLA with buffer

Title: Run initial load (backfill)
Description: Execute historic full load in off-peak window; monitor resource usage; verify counts.
Acceptance Criteria: Row counts and checksums match tolerances

Title: Cutover to CDC
Description: Enable continuous sync; verify CDC behavior; check deletes handling.
Client Dependencies: Stable initial state; vendor CDC configured
Deliverables: CDC enabled with documented lag metrics
Acceptance Criteria: Lag within SLA for 3 consecutive days

Title: Freshness/latency monitoring
Description: Implement lag queries using source timestamps vs. target; store metrics and alert on threshold breaches.
Acceptance Criteria: Alerts trigger on simulated lag

Title: Data quality checks
Description: Implement row-count, PK uniqueness, null checks on critical columns; schedule validations post-sync.
Acceptance Criteria: All checks passing or documented exemptions

Title: Integrate with Airflow (start + wait)
Description: Use vendor API/operator to trigger syncs and sensors to wait for completion before downstream tasks (dbt, refreshes).
Acceptance Criteria: DAG runs end-to-end with gating

Title: Scheduling alignment with downstream
Description: Align DAG schedules to connector completion; consider offsets and long runs; avoid overlaps.
Acceptance Criteria: No contention; SLAs met

Title: Operational runbook & incident response
Description: Document failure modes, re-sync procedures, schema change handling, and contact trees; include vendor support steps.
Acceptance Criteria: Reviewed by ops; on-call briefed

Title: Knowledge transfer & sign-off
Description: Deliver walkthrough and handover, including dashboards, DQ results, and runbook.
Acceptance Criteria: Sign-off from client PM and data owner

Title: Define additional business metadata columns
Description: Add standardized business metadata columns (e.g., record_source, business_unit, data_sensitivity) to support governance and lineage.
Acceptance Criteria: Columns present and populated in target

Title: Group objects by transactional integrity (from SOURCE FK graph)
Description: Persist dependency groupings derived from SOURCE FKs into reference tables; use for parent-first DAG ordering and validation.
Acceptance Criteria: Downstream DAG uses grouping correctly

Title: Table selection refinement
Description: Refine enabled table list based on usage analytics and SLA; exclude low-value/high-churn tables; document rationale.
Acceptance Criteria: Change approved; sync time reduced

Title: Alert routing & escalation
Description: Integrate vendor alerts and custom Snowflake checks into client’s tooling (e.g., Slack, PagerDuty, email).
Acceptance Criteria: Test alerts reach correct groups

Title: Cost monitoring dashboard
Description: Track warehouse credits and storage; attribute costs to connector workload; alert on anomalies.
Acceptance Criteria: Monthly report generated

Title: Automate FK export per source
Description: Implement scripts/queries to extract FK metadata from the SOURCE database on a schedule; persist to reference tables for reproducible builds.
Client Dependencies: Read access to SOURCE catalogs (e.g., sys.* / ALL_* / INFORMATION_SCHEMA); service account
Deliverables: Scheduled FK export job; populated REF_DEPENDENCY_* tables
Acceptance Criteria: Nightly export refreshes FK metadata without errors

Title: Construct dependency graph from FK rows
Description: Transform exported FK rows into a directed graph (parent->child), detect cycles/missing PKs, and compute topological layers for load ordering.
Acceptance Criteria: Graph validates with no unresolved nodes

Title: Generate DAG constraints from dependency graph
Description: Emit DAG edges so parent tasks complete before children; integrate with Airflow operators/sensors for the vendor connector.
Deliverables: Airflow DAG section defining upstream/downstream per FK graph
Acceptance Criteria: DAG honors parent-first ordering in test runs
Orchestration Integration: Airflow: task groups by dependency layer

Title: Handle sources without declared FKs
Description: Infer likely dependencies using naming conventions, index usage, data profiling, and SME input; record as logical dependencies in reference tables.
Client Dependencies: SME time; sampling rights on key tables
Deliverables: Documented logical FK map; reference table entries
Acceptance Criteria: Approved by application owner; feeds DAG constraints
